intro: Dissochaeta sumatrana, commonly known as the Sumatran dissochaeta, is a flowering plant native to the Indonesian island of Sumatra. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes coffee and gardenias, and is characterized by its small, clustered flowers. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 2 meters. Its leaves are opposite, elliptical, and have a glossy surface, while its flowers are usually white or pale yellow. Dissochaeta sumatrana is adapted to the tropical climate of its native habitat, thriving in humid, shaded environments.
